metadata.Title: CVE-2022-39046 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in the GNU C Library (glibc) 2.36. When the syslog function is passed a crafted input string larger than 1024 bytes, it reads uninitialized memory from the heap and prints it to the target log file, potentially revealing a portion of the contents of the heap.

criterions.comment: eglibc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
